main event: A bright object, round and sometimes cigar-shaped, was observed over Ft. Pierce, Florida on 27 February 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a 50 cent piece, emitting a yellowish-white light,It was bright enough to be seen through clouds,The object had erratic movements, moving in an arc to the north,It faded over the horizon after about 3 minutes of observation,There were military operations in the area which possibly related to flares.
